sentences.en: A gray brick tunnel, dimly lighted, led to the elevator shaft.
sentences.cn: 一条点着昏暗灯光的灰色砖砌通道通往电梯的并道.

sentences.en: Ayer was dimly known to me, England being one of those rare countries in which each era has a few public philosophers — respected thinkers who are called upon to comment on the issues of the day.
sentences.cn: 我对艾耶尔有些朦胧的认识，很少有国家在每个时代都有几个公众哲学家——曾受邀就当时问题发表看法的受人尊重的思想者，英国正是其中之一。

sentences.en: Ecological sciences were only dimly understood in the late 19th century.
sentences.cn: 19世纪末，人们对生态科学只有朦胧的认识。

sentences.en: He followed her into a dimly lit kitchen.
sentences.cn: 他跟着她走进光线暗淡的厨房。

sentences.en: He was only dimly aware that it was raining.
sentences.cn: 他只是模模糊糊地意识到天在下雨.

sentences.en: I was dimly aware that dozens of curious people were looking at us.
sentences.cn: 我迷迷糊糊地感觉到有数十个人在好奇地看着我们。

sentences.en: In Milton's poem, Satan, even after his fall, dimly reflects his former glory.
sentences.cn: 在弥尔顿的诗中, 撒旦即便失败后, 也能依稀显出昔日的荣光.

sentences.en: McTeague besan dimly to feel that life was too much for him.
sentences.cn: 麦克梯格开始迷迷糊糊的觉得做人实在太难了.

sentences.en: She dimly realized that she was trembling.
sentences.cn: 她隐约感到自己在发抖.

sentences.en: She was dimly aware of voices shouting.
sentences.cn: 她隐约听到有人在喊叫.

sentences.en: The room was dimly illuminated by the soft glow of his bedside lamp.
sentences.cn: 他床头的灯发出柔和的光,淡淡地照着整个房间.

sentences.en: The shoreline could be dimly seen.
The Wild Goose Pagoda was dimly visible.
Though the shoreline could be dimly seen, it was impossible to judge how far away it was.
sentences.cn: 虽然能够隐隐约约看到海岸线，但无法估计出大概有多远。

words.tran_cn: 暗淡的，昏暗的；模糊的，看不清的；悲观的，怀疑的
[车辆] 调光器；光暗掣；衰减器
使暗淡；变模糊（dim的过去式）
使暗淡，使失去光泽；使变模糊

trans.tran_cn: 昏暗地，朦胧地，模糊地，依稀，影影绰绰，隐隐约约
